items.title: G Gordon Liddy, Watergate mastermind, dead at 90
items.description: Liddy, a mastermind of the Watergate burglary and a radio talk show host after emerging from prison, has died at age 90. His son, Thomas Liddy, confirmed the death Tuesday, March 30, 2021, but did not reveal the cause

items.title: Pandemic pushes gender equality back a generation: WEF
items.description: "The pandemic has fundamentally impacted gender equality in both the workplace and the home, rolling back years of progress," said WEF's managing director Saadia Zahidi.

items.title: She’s vaccinated against Covid-19. He isn’t. Now what?
items.description: After a year spent navigating job losses and lockdowns, sickness and fear, some families are experiencing the long-awaited arrival of vaccines with not elation or relief, but a fraught combination of confusion, jealousy or guilt.

items.title: Brutal attack on Filipino woman in New York sparks outrage: ‘Everybody is on edge’
items.description: The sheer brazenness of the attack — combined with the seeming indifference of the bystanders — caused another wave of fear for many Asian Americans already worn down by a steady drumbeat of assaults.

items.title: U.S. condemns China moves to further reduce Hong Kong political participation
items.description: The sweeping overhaul of Hong Kong's electoral system will drastically curb democratic representation as authorities seek to ensure "patriots" rule the global financial hub.

items.title: Biden to let Trump’s H1-B visa ban expire in win for tech firms
items.description: Biden’s decision will please business groups, which had pressured the administration to lift the ban ever since the new president took office. Executives have grown frustrated that the directive was not immediately revoked, arguing it hurt US companies.

items.title: Brazil military chiefs quit as Bolsonaro seeks their support
items.description: The Defense Ministry reported the resignations — apparently unprecedented since at least the end of military rule 36 years ago — in a statement released without giving reasons. Replacements were not named.

items.title: Witnesses to George Floyd’s deadly arrest tell jury of their shock, horror
items.description: Witness after witness described how Chauvin was unmoved by their pleas, with the teenager who shot the harrowing video of the arrest that set off nationwide protests testifying that the officer gave the crowd a ``cold'' and ``heartless'' stare.

items.title: NCP-UML leaders call on party workers to oppose ‘dictator’ Oli
items.description: The joint statement by the leaders ― all members of the party's powerful standing committee, including former PMs Jhala Nath Khanal and Madhav Kumar Nepal ― comes in wake of Oli assuming sweeping powers to seek clarification and suspend any leader for “indiscipline”.

items.title: Tanzania: 45 people died in stampede to see ex-president’s body
items.description: According to Tanzanian police, 45 people died in a stampede last week during a public viewing of the late President John Magufuli's body before he was buried.

items.title: China approves Hong Kong electoral system reform bill
items.description: Under the changes approved by China's National People's Congress Standing Committee, the number of directly elected representatives to Hong Kong's legislature will fall from 35 to 20, while the size of the legislature would increase from 70 to 90 seats.

items.title: Myanmar protests: Death toll passes 500
items.description: Activists in Yangon have launched a "garbage strike" while armed rebel groups have demanded the military stop the bloodshed or face retaliation.

items.title: Kim Jong Un’s sister calls South Korean leader a ‘parrot’
items.description: Kim Yo Jong has called criticism of weapons tests conducted by North Korea "shameless." The US and South Korea have condemned last week's firing of ballistic missiles.

items.title: Mexican president condemns death of Salvadoran woman in police custody
items.description: Salazar's killers would quickly face justice, Lopez Obrador said, vowing that there would be "no impunity."Autopsy findings showed Salazar died from spinal fracture caused by the rupture of the first and second vertebrae, the attorney general's office of Quintana Roo state said.

items.title: Pakistan’s Textile Ministry asks Govt to lift ban on import of cotton from India
items.description: The government's decision to consider lifting the ban from India came as a big relief for the value-added textile sector, which seeks access to cheap raw materials.

items.title: An alliance of autocracies? China wants to lead a new world order
items.description: China hopes to position itself as the main challenger to an international order, led by the United States, that is generally guided by principles of democracy, respect for human rights and adherence to rule of law.

items.title: Capitol riot suspect wore ‘I Was There’ shirt when arrested
items.description: Garret Miller's shirt had a photograph of former President Donald Trump, and it said “Take America Back” and “I Was There, Washington D.C., January 6, 2021,” federal prosecutors noted in a court filing Monday.

items.title: Pfizer, Moderna COVID-19 vaccines highly effective after first shot: Study
items.description: The risk of infection fell 90% by two weeks after the second shot, the study of nearly 4,000 U.S. healthcare personnel and first responders found.

items.title: Traffic in Suez Canal resumes after stranded ship refloated; backlog could be cleared within 4 days
items.description: Vessels waiting to transit the canal include dozens of container ships, bulk carriers, oil tankers and liquefied natural gas (LNG) or liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) vessels, Nile TV reported.

items.title: New York to open up COVID-19 vaccine to all adults on April 6
items.description: The move comes amid a surge in COVID-19 cases in New York and neighboring New Jersey, which now rank No. 1 and 2 in new infections per capita among all 50 states, underscoring the pressure to roll out vaccines as quickly as possible.

items.title: Woman says Gov. Cuomo forcibly kissed her cheeks in 2017
items.description: Cuomo has denied touching anyone inappropriately but said he's sorry if he made anyone uncomfortable. The governor has said his tendency to hug and kiss people as a greeting stems from his Italian-American heritage.

items.title: Canada pauses AstraZeneca vaccine for under 55
items.description: The National Advisory Committee on Immunization recommended a pause on AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccinations for people under 55 for safety reasons and the Canadian provinces, which administer health in the country, announced the suspensions Monday.

items.title: Ghislaine Maxwell faces new charges as US expands sex crime case
items.description: Maxwell, 59, has remain in a federal jail without bail after a judge three times rejected bail packages, the last of which included offers to renounce her citizenships in the United Kingdom and France, to be kept in place by armed guards and to post $28.5 million in assets.

items.title: Venezuela’s Maduro seeks to sideline opposition with ‘oil-for-vaccines’ plan: Lawmakers
items.description: Maduro on Sunday proposed an “oil-for-vaccines” deal, without providing details on how such a scheme would work

items.title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro shuffles Cabinet as COVID-19 pressure mounts
items.description: Three ministers left the government, including Foreign Minister Ernesto Araujo, a China hawk whose departure followed mounting criticism from lawmakers of his failure to guarantee additional COVID-19 vaccine supplies from Beijing and Washington.

items.title: KP Oli suspends rebel leaders from Nepal ruling party
items.description: Suspending both leaders from the party for six months, Oli indicated that the decision on whether they would be brought back into the party fold would depend on their behaviour.

items.title: Thais deny army forcing back Myanmar refugees fleeing air strikes
items.description: Video showed villagers carrying their belongings boarding boats under the watch of Thai officials. Authorities blocked Reuters reporters from accessing the area.

items.title: China refutes Blinken’s charge it helped to write WHO experts’ report on COVID-19 origin
items.description: Blinken in an interview to CNN on Sunday expressed concern about the "methodology and the process" followed by the forthcoming WHO report on the origin of the coronavirus.

items.title: Giant container ship that blocked Suez Canal set free
items.description: Video released by the Suez Canal Authority showed the Ever Given being escorted by the tugboats that helped free it, each sounding off their horns in jubilation after nearly a week of chaos.

items.title: Nomura, Credit Suisse warn of big losses after Archegos share dump
items.description: Losses at Archegos Capital Management, run by former Tiger Asia manager Bill Hwang, had triggered a fire sale of stocks on Friday, a source familiar with the matter said.

items.title: French pharma giant found guilty over deadly diet pill
items.description: A court has found French drugmaker Servier guilty of "involuntary manslaughter" over a weight loss pill that has been blamed for hundreds of deaths. The case is one of the worst health scandals ever to hit France.

items.title: George Floyd: Family holds prayer service ahead of trial
items.description: A jury will hear the opening arguments Monday in the trial of a former police officer facing a number of charges into the death of Black man George Floyd.

items.title: Fridges, microwaves fall prey to global chip shortage
items.description: The U.S. based company, one of the world's largest white goods firm, is falling behind on exports to Europe and the United States from China, by as much as 25% on some months, Jason Ai told Reuters in Shanghai.

items.title: Richest Czech man among 5 killed in Alaska helicopter crash
items.description: The only other person onboard was in serious condition but stable Sunday at an Anchorage hospital, Alaska State Troopers said.

items.title: Lebanon’s Zahrani power plant shuts down after gas oil runs out
items.description: Lebanon, which is grappling with a deep financial crisis triggered by a mountain of debt, already lacks power generation capacity, so homes and businesses face power cuts for several hours each day.

items.title: Angela Merkel blames German ‘perfectionism’ for current virus woes
items.description: In a lengthy television interview with public broadcaster ARD late Sunday, Merkel acknowledged that mistakes were made by her government, including on plans for an Easter lockdown.

items.title: Obama family matriarch dies in a Kenyan hospital at 99
items.description: Sarah Obama was the second wife of President Obama's grandfather and helped raise his father, Barack Obama Sr. The family is a part of Kenya's Luo ethnic group.

items.title: Australian PM promotes women in cabinet reshuffle amid poll slump
items.description: In a move designed to regain voter support, Morrison said he would now have a record seven female lawmakers in his Cabinet as he awarded promotions and additional remits to five women.

items.title: Netherlands: Churchgoers breaking COVID rules attack journalists
items.description: Worshippers flouting pandemic measures in the Netherlands have responded to media attention with violence. Lawmakers have slammed the attacks on reporters.

items.title: US: Two killed, one wounded in shooting at Maryland convenience store
items.description: The police in Baltimore County were investigating whether the deadly shooting at a Royal Farms store was related to a fire and another fatal shooting 15 minutes later at a nearby apartment complex.

items.title: Google aims to be the anti-Amazon of e-commerce. It has a long way to go
items.description: Google is trying to present itself as a cheaper and less restrictive option for independent sellers.

items.title: WHO report says animals likely source of Covid-19: report
items.description: The findings were largely as expected and left many questions unanswered. The team proposed further research in every area except the lab leak hypothesis.

items.title: His plane crashed in the Amazon. Then came the hard part.
items.description: Since becoming a pilot nine years earlier, Antônio Sena had heard countless stories about fatal crashes. But while his plane scraped a few trees and then smashed into the ground, Sena realized something exhilarating as he rolled to a halt: He had survived.

items.title: Covid keeps spreading death where vaccines haven’t reached
items.description: Last week, World Health Organization Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said that the unequal supply of vaccines “is not just a moral outrage, it is also economically and epidemiologically self defeating.”

items.title: Thousands flee into Thailand following Myanmar air strikes
items.description: Earlier Sunday, an estimated 3,000 people crossed the river dividing the two countries into Thailand's Mae Hong Son province following two days of aerial attacks.

items.title: Hopes of reopening Suez Canal boosted by partial refloating of jammed ship
items.description: The 400-metre (430-yard) long Ever Given was successfully re-floated at 4.30 am local time (0230 GMT) and was being secured, Inchcape, a global provider of marine services said on Twitter.

items.title: ‘Absolutely outrageous’: Biden expresses outrage over civilian killings in Myanmar
items.description: Over a 100 people lost their lives on Saturday, Myanmar’s National Armed Forces Day, and shots were fired at the American Center of Yangon, in an incident that is being investigated, Congressman Gregory Meeks, Chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Committee, said.

items.title: UK’s Johnson urges caution as some lockdown measures ease
items.description: From Monday, up to six people, or two households, in England can meet outside whilst outdoor sporting facilities such as tennis and basketball courts can be used with social contact limits in place.

items.title: Australia’s third-largest city to enter three-day COVID-19 lockdown
items.description: About 2 million people in the city, the country's third largest and the capital of Queensland state, will be required to stay home from 5 pm local time except for essential work, healthcare, grocery shopping or exercise.

items.title: Australian PM Scott Morrison’s approval rating falls to lowest in a year
items.description: If the poll result was replicated at an election, the conservative government would lose office to centre-left Labor. The Australian parliament has been engulfed by allegations of sexual abuse, discrimination against women and misconduct.

items.title: US: Teen girls charged with murder, carjacking of Pak-origin driver
items.description: Mohammad Anwar, 66, died when police said the girls, armed with a taser, sped off in his car as he clung to the driver's side with the door open and crashed seconds later just outside the ballpark of the Washington Nationals.

items.title: Inside Myanmar’s army: ‘They see protesters as criminals’
items.description: On Saturday, the deadliest day since the Feb. 1 coup, security forces killed more than 100 people, according to the United Nations.

items.title: Funerals become scenes of Myanmar resistance, more violence
items.description: Some of the funerals held Sunday became themselves opportunities to demonstrate resistance to the junta.

items.title: N. Korea accuses UN of double standard over missile firings
items.description: Last week, North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles into the sea in a defiance of U.N. resolutions that ban such launches by North Korea.

items.title: Helicopter crash in Alaska backcountry ski trip kills 5
items.description: The Eurocopter AS50 crashed under unknown circumstances about 50 miles (80 kilometers) east of Anchorage at 6:35 p.m. Saturday, the Federal Aviation Administration said Sunday.

items.title: Venezuela accuses Facebook of ‘digital totalitarianism’ for suspending Maduro
items.description: Maduro, who has overseen an economic collapse since taking office in 2013 and is labeled a dictator by Washington and many other Western nations, said in a tweet on Sunday that he would broadcast his daily coronavirus briefing on the Facebook account of his wife, first lady Cilia Flores.

items.title: Defense chiefs from 12 countries condemn protest deaths in Myanmar
items.description: Nations including Germany and the US jointly decried the military violence which resulted in over 100 deaths in one day. Protesters have returned to the streets of Yangon and Mandalay in further defiance of the junta.

items.title: Troops fire at funeral as Myanmar mourns bloodiest day since coup
items.description: Three people were killed in other shooting incidents on Sunday and thousands of villagers in a border area fled to Thailand after army air strikes on one of several ethnic militias.

items.title: Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinya to step down in April
items.description: Pashinyan has been under increasing pressure to step down following a military defeat against neighboring Azerbaijan and an ongoing spat with Armenian military leaders.

items.title: Indian-origin boy finds millions of years old fossil in UK garden
items.description: Siddak Singh Jhamat, known as Sid, was using a fossil-hunting set he received as a Christmas present when he came across a rock that looked like a horn.

items.title: Two tugboats speed to Egypt’s Suez Canal as shippers avoid it
items.description: The massive Ever Given, a Panama-flagged, Japanese-owned ship that carries cargo between Asia and Europe, got stuck Tuesday in a single-lane stretch of the canal.

items.title: Coronavirus digest: Mexico reports 120,000 ‘untested’ deaths
items.description: Mexico's government has acknowledged that the country's true death toll from coronavirus stands above 321,000, almost 60% more than the official number of 201,429.

items.title: Mozambique: Militants seize town, Total halts LNG operations
items.description: Jihadis have seized a town and also allegedly attacked a convoy of fleeing civilians, including foreign workers, as fighting continued in the gas-rich region.

items.title: Jailed Kremlin critic Navalny asks for painkiller injections – public commission
items.description: The 44-year old opposition politician has said in a statement that his request for treatment by a civilian doctor had been rejected and that he was being woken up by a guard every hour during the night in a deliberate attempt to undermine his health.

items.title: Bangladesh violence spreads after Modi visit, attacks on Hindu temples, train
items.description: Local police and doctors have said at least 11 protesters have been killed since Friday in clashes with police during demonstrations organised by Islamist groups against the Indian leader's visit.

items.title: ‘Un-American’, ‘safe, fair, accessible’: How Democrats and Republicans reacted to Georgia’s new election law
items.description: The new law, which was passed by both chambers of the state legislature and signed by Republican Governor Brian Kemp on Thursday, adds restrictions to voting, that some argue will disproportionately impact black Americans.

items.title: UK variant hunters lead global race to stay ahead of COVID
items.description: The initiative helped make Britain a world leader in rapidly analyzing the genetic material from large numbers of COVID-19 infections, generating more than 40 per cent of the genomic sequences identified to date.

items.title: Beijing enveloped in hazardous sandstorm, second time in two weeks
items.description: Visibility in the city was reduced, with the tops of some skyscrapers obscured by the sandstorm, and pedestrians were forced to cover their eyes as gusts of dust swept through the streets.

items.title: Expelled from US at night, migrant families weigh next steps
items.description: The decisions unfold amid what Border Patrol officials say is an extraordinarily high 30-day average of 5,000 daily encounters with migrants.

items.title: Suicide and self-harm: Bereaved families count the costs of lockdowns
items.description: As more people are vaccinated, and communities open up, there is a tally that experts say is harder to track: the psychological toll of months of isolation and global suffering, which for some has proved fatal.

items.title: Suspected suicide bombing at Indonesian church wounds 14 people
items.description: Local police had previously said the bomber had acted alone. Authorities were looking into which radical networks the bombers came from and whether the attack was linked to recent arrests of suspected militants, national police spokesman Argo Yuwono said.

items.title: A collapse foretold: How Brazil’s Covid-19 outbreak overwhelmed hospitals
items.description: More than a year into the pandemic, deaths in Brazil are at their peak and highly contagious variants of the coronavirus are sweeping the nation, enabled by political dysfunction, widespread complacency and conspiracy theories.

items.title: At the Suez Canal, hoping a rising tide will lift a boat 4 football fields long
items.description: If the ship breaks free by Monday, the shipping industry can absorb the inconvenience, analysts said, but beyond that, supply chains and consumers could start to see major disruptions.

items.title: Myanmar mourns bloodiest day since coup, UN investigator condemns ‘mass murder’
items.description: The dead included 40 people, one of them a 13-year-old girl, in Myanmar's second city of Mandalay. At least 27 people were killed in the commercial hub Yangon, Myanmar Now said. Another 13-year-old was among the dead in the central Sagaing region.

items.title: Hong Kong says initial investigation of BioNTech vaccines shows no ‘obvious systemic factors’
items.description: Authorities on Wednesday halted the use of a COVID-19 vaccine developed by BioNTech citing defective packaging, triggering confusion in inoculation centres across the city.

items.title: Ship blocking Suez Canal moves slightly, unclear when it will refloat
items.description: A combination of dredging material from around the ship and pulling and pushing the vessel with tugboats made minor progress in dislodging the ship on Saturday, two SCA sources said. One source said there had been some movement at the bow of the ship.

items.title: One dead, six injured in stabbing attack at Canadian library
items.description: Sgt. Frank Jang of the Integrated Homicide Investigation Team said a suspect was in custody. He said the man is in his 20s and has had interactions with police in the past.

items.title: 5,000 attend rock concert in Barcelona after COVID-19 screen
items.description: Five thousand rock fans enjoyed a real-as-can-be concert after passing a same-day coronavirus screening, to test its effectiveness in preventing outbreaks of the virus at large cultural events.

items.title: The art of the Vladimir Putin photo shoot
items.description: In a series of photos of Putin on a weekend jaunt to the snowy Siberian taiga, the 68-year-old president is shown in his usual favorite outdoor setting, displaying his connection to nature, manly toughness and appreciation of country.

items.title: Indonesia’s Merapi volcano spews ash, debris in new eruption
items.description: The 2,968-meter (9,737-foot) high volcano is on densely populated Java island near the ancient city of Yogyakarta. It is the most active of dozens of Indonesian volcanoes and has repeatedly erupted recently.

items.title: Police: 2 dead in Virginia Beach oceanfront shootings
items.description: Eight people were shot just after 11 p.m. Friday, Virginia Beach police said in a news release. All eight were taken to local hospitals, with some of their conditions ranging from serious to life-threatening.

items.title: Suez Canal blockage: 4 of the biggest trade chokepoints
items.description: The Ever Given, a 400-meter (1,300-foot) container ship got stranded in Egypt's Suez Canal on Tuesday and has since been blocking the vital maritime passageway between Asia and Europe.

items.title: At least 91 killed in one of deadliest days since coup: Myanmar media
items.description: Dozens of people have been killed in a fresh crackdown on Myanmar's protest movement, according to local media. The leader of the military junta marked Armed Forces Day by promising new elections.

items.title: Opinion: Extending Germany’s Afghanistan mission a mistake
items.description: The German parliament, the Bundestag, has extended the Bundeswehr's mandate in Afghanistan by another year. But lawmakers no longer seem interested in the meaning of the mission, says Christoph Hasselbach.

items.title: Spurred by lockdown, Spain gives 4-day week a try
items.description: A three-year pilot project will be using 50 million euros (USD 59 million) from the European Union's massive coronavirus recovery fund to compensate some 200 mid-size companies as they resize their workforce or reorganise production workflows to adapt to a 32-hour working week.

items.title: Poland plans pensions for dogs, horses in state employment
items.description: The new law would affect some 1,200 dogs and more than 60 horses currently in service.

items.title: World Bank signs fresh loan agreements worth USD 1.336 billion with Pakistan
items.description: Najy Benhassine, Country Director of the World Bank, signed the agreements on behalf of his organisation. Minister for Economic Affairs Khusro Bakhtyar also attended the ceremony.

items.title: Prosecution failed to prove guilt of main accused in Daniel Pearl case: Pakistan SC
items.description: The Sindh High Court (SHC) on April 2, 2020 commuted the death sentence of Sheikh convicted of kidnapping and murdering US journalist Pearl in 2002 to seven years and acquitted three others who were serving life terms in the case, almost two decades after they were found guilty and jailed.

items.title: Officials Try to Sway Biden Using Intelligence on Potential for Taliban Takeover of Afghanistan
items.description: Some senior Biden administration officials have expressed skepticism of any intelligence prediction of a resurgence of a weakened al-Qaida or of the Islamic State group.

items.title: ‘Don’t shoot,’ Ethiopian father begged Eritrean soldiers, daughter says
items.description: It was 10 days into Ethiopia's military campaign against fighters from the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF), the region's former ruling party, following their surprise assault on federal army bases in Tigray.

items.title: Brazil posts record 3,650 new Covid-19 deaths, unveils two homegrown vaccines
items.description: Pressure has been mounting on President Jair Bolsonaro to tackle a public health crisis he has minimized, shunning masks, railing against lockdowns and sowing doubts about vaccines.

items.title: All-India crew of cargo ship wedged in Egypt’s Suez Canal safe; losses mount on
items.description: So far, dredgers have tried to clear silt around the massive ship. Tug boats nudged the vessel alongside it, trying to gain momentum. From the shore, at least one backhoe dug into the canal’s sandy banks, suggesting the bow of the ship had plowed into it.

items.title: Chinese apps join celebs in backlash against Western fashion brands over Xinjiang
items.description: H&M faced a public backlash in China when social media users in the country circulated a statement the company made last year announcing it would no longer source cotton from Xinjiang after reports of the use of forced labour by Uighur Muslims.

items.title: North Korea snaps back at Biden over criticism of launches
items.description: The statement issued by senior official Ri Pyong Chol came after the North on Thursday tested-fired two short-range missiles off its eastern coast in the first ballistic launches since Biden took office.

items.title: White House considering supporting India, S Africa move at WTO on COVID vaccines: Report
items.description: Such a positive consideration by the Joe Biden administration comes after more than 60 lawmakers, mostly progressives, and a large number of rights and non-profit pharma bodies have approached the White House to support the move of India and South Africa along with hundreds of other nations that have urgently gone to the WTO seeking a time-limited waiver of the TRIPS agreement.

items.title: Georgia law kicks off partisan battle over voting rights
items.description: Georgia’s sweeping new provisions, passed by a Republican-controlled Legislature, represent the most substantive overhaul of a battleground state’s voting system since last November’s election.

items.title: Plan made to refloat ship blocking Suez Canal using tide
items.description: The Ever Given, owned by Japanese firm Shoei Kisen KK, got wedged Tuesday in a single-lane stretch of the canal, about 6 kilometers north of the southern entrance, near the city of Suez.

items.title: UN-backed programme laments Covid-19 vaccine supply woes, looks to US
items.description: Vaccine supply concerns have weighed in particularly on hard-hit countries like those in the European Union and in India in recent weeks, causing a surge in so-called vaccine nationalism in some places.

items.title: Biden invites 40 world leaders including PM Modi to virtual Leaders’ Summit on Climate
items.description: The two-day summit will be held virtually on April 22-23 and will be telecasted live for public viewing.

items.title: Suez canal blockage: Egypt races to free giant vessel with help of several tugboats
items.description: The Ever Given, a Panama-flagged ship that carries cargo between Asia and Europe, ran aground Tuesday in the narrow, man-made canal dividing continental Africa from the Sinai Peninsula.

items.title: At least 32 killed, 66 injured in major train crash in southern Egypt
items.description: Local media displayed videos from the scene showing flipped wagons with passengers trapped inside and surrounded by rubble. Some victims seemed unconscious while others could be see bleeding.

items.title: China targets UK lawmakers, others in response to Xinjiang sanctions
items.description: China targets UK officials in response to Xinjiang sanctions

items.title: EU leaders eye potential Turkey trade-off on gas, migrants
items.description: The EU wants Turkey to respect international law and is ready to offer access to its customs union. The bloc wants to thrash out an agreement with Ankara on Cyprus, energy and refugees.

items.title: North Korea defector to run for office in UK first
items.description: Sixteen years after she was left to die outside a labor camp in North Korea, Jihyun Park could be about to make British history.

items.description: China this week has pushed a campaign to boycott Western retailers after the U.S., U.K., Canada and the European Union imposed sanctions over human-rights abuses against ethnic minority Uyghurs in Xinjiang.

items.title: Lebanon receives Russian vaccines imported by private sector
items.description: Lebanon is currently in the grips of the worst economic and financial crisis in its modern history, which has been exacerbated by the lockdown measures related to the pandemic.

items.title: People coming to US southern border and crossing it being sent back: Biden
items.description: Responding to a question on the crisis at the southern border, he said it happens every single solitary year. “There is a significant increase in the number of people coming to the border in the winter months of January, February, March. It happens every year.”

items.title: US gives $15 million to Palestinians to deal with COVID-19
items.description: In the Israeli-occupied West Bank, Palestinian Prime Minister Mohammad Shtayyeh welcomed the U.S. financial support to the Palestinian Authority’s efforts to fight the COVID-19 pandemic.

items.title: Ethiopia says Eritrea agrees to withdraw troops from Tigray
items.description: The statement by Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed's office comes after intense pressure from the United States and others to address the deadly crisis in Tigray.

items.title: EU leaders grapple with surge of infections, vaccine issues

items.description: The record caseload, along with 2,777 more COVID-19 deaths, comes a day after Brazil surpassed 300,000 fatalities from the pandemic, the world's worst death toll after the United States.

items.title: India calls for direct peace talks between Israel, Palestine based on global consensus
items.description: Israel and Palestine have been in conflict for decades over various political issues such as borders, refugees and the control of Jerusalem.

items.title: Biden sets goal of 200 million COVID-19 vaccine shots in 100 days of his administration
items.description: Biden has already achieved his previous goal of 100 million shots in 100 days, 42 days ahead of the schedule.

items.title: Biden says he plans to run for re-election in 2024
items.description: "My plan is to run for re-election. That's my expectation," Biden told reporters at the White House.

items.title: Israel polls: No clear winner as final results confirm deadlock
items.description: Mansour Abbas, an Arab leader in Israel seems to have emerged as the unusual "kingmaker" whose possible support has split open differences not only in the ruling Likud party, but also in its right-wing coalition.

items.description: In Pelham, Alabama, about 60 miles southwest of Ohatchee, fire chief Mike Reid told news website Al.com that about 60 homes were damaged in the area, but no fatalities or injuries were reported.

items.title: Fuel tank attacked, catches fire in southern Saudi Arabia
items.description: The kingdom has faced an increasing number of such assaults and the tempo hasn't slowed since it offered a cease-fire deal to the Houthis on Monday.

items.title: China set to lead recovery of East Asian and Pacific economies -World Bank
items.description: China and Vietnam were among the relatively few countries that were only lightly hit by the pandemic and did not fall into recession in 2020.

items.title: Missile tests propel N.Korea to top of Biden foreign agenda
items.description: The United States condemned Thursday's launches, which came hours before Biden held his first White House press conference since taking office in January.

items.title: US adds India to list of countries affected by African swine fever
items.description: ASF is a highly contagious animal disease of wild and domestic swine. It can spread rapidly in swine populations with extremely high rates of morbidity and mortality.

items.title: At first solo news conference, Biden says he plans to run again, defends US-Mexico border policy

items.title: Chinese military says situation in eastern Ladakh ‘eased distinctly’ but silent on further pullout of troops
items.description: The Indian Army has been pitching for a faster disengagement process in areas like Hot Springs, Gogra and Depsang to bring down tension in the mountainous region.

Jaishankar added that ensuring Afghanistan is free of terrorism, violent extremism and drug and criminal syndicates is a “collective imperative”.

items.title: WHO chief seeks deeper probe into Covid lab leak theory as world leaders make pact to fight future pandemics
items.description: World Health Organisation Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus pointed to difficulties that the WHO team faced in researching the origins of Covid-19 in China's Wuhan and called for a deeper probe of the theory that the virus leaked from a lab as more than 20 world leaders called for an international treaty for pandemic preparedness that will protect future generations in the wake of Covid-19.

items.title: Covid-19 second wave: More than 80 per cent beds in Punjab’s Covid hospitals unoccupied
items.description: Even as India battles its second wave of Covid-19, more than 80 per cent of beds in Punjab’s Covid hospitals remain unoccupied. Most patients in the state have been advised home isolation.

items.title: Bangladesh coach 'frustrated' after bizarre DLS drama vs New Zealand: Batsmen weren't aware about the target
items.description: New Zealand vs Bangladesh: In the rain-curtailed match. the play was halted for a brief moment during Bangladesh's run-chase because of a bizarre confusion over DLS target for the visitors. Match officials revised the target to 170 in 16 overs from 148 in 16 overs. The target was again revised to 171 after the 13th over.

items.title: Puducherry election: Not willing to take on CM post, says Congress leader and ex-CM Narayanasamy
items.description: Senior Congress leader and former Puducherry Chief Minister V Narayanasamy said on Tuesday that he is not willing to take on the chief ministerial post in the union territory if his party comes to power in the assembly election.

items.title: Fact Check: TMC to win 26 of 30 Phase 1 seats in Bengal? Viral opinion poll screenshot is fake
items.description: A screenshot of ABP News exit poll survey is going viral on social media, with the claim that Trinamool is likely to win 23-26 of the 30 seats in Bengal that went to polls in the first phase on March 27.

items.title: Will Himanta Biswa Sarma dance the BJP to victory this time too?
items.description: During the poll campaigning for the second phase of the state Assembly polls, Himanta took up what has now become his unique style to seek votes for the BJP in different parts of the state, aimed at enthusing the party workers and wooing voters.

items.title: IPL 2021: Best man for the job - Shreyas Iyer reacts after Rishabh Pant named Delhi Capitals captain
items.description: IPL 2021: Reacting to the news of Rishabh Pant replacing him as the captain of Delhi Capitals, Shreyas Iyer has said that he was having no doubt that the wicketkeeper-batsman will be the best man to lead the team. Iyer has been ruled out of the IPL 2021 due to a shoulder injury.

items.title: Can't wait to give my absolute best for DC: Rishabh Pant after being named captain for IPL 2021
items.description: Rishabh Pant has never led an Indian Premier league side and only played in the cash-rich T20 tournament for Delhi capitals since making his debut in 2016.

items.title: German cities suspend AstraZeneca vaccine use for under-60s
items.description: Authorities in Berlin and Munich are again suspending the use of AstraZeneca’s coronavirus vaccine for residents under age 60 due to new reports of unusual blood clots in people who recently received the shots.

items.title: Gujarat: Covid-19 cases at IIM-Ahmedabad rise to 191, 86 students infected
items.description: The number of Covid-19 cases at the Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad, has risen to 191. Of these, 86 are students. Most of them are asymptomatic, according to an official.

items.title: 10 points
items.description: The central government on Tuesday said that the coronavirus situation in the country is turning from bad to worse, the whole country is at risk.

items.title: Delhi Capitals name Rishabh Pant captain for IPL 2021, Shreyas Iyer ruled out with shoulder injury
items.description: Rishabh Pant has been named captain of Delhi Capitals for the entire season of IPL 2021. Regular skipper Shreyas Iyer has been ruled out of the tournament with a shoulder injury.

items.title: Dance Deewane crew members test positive for Covid-19, sets sanitised
items.description: Some crew members associated with reality show Dance Deewane have tested positive for Covid-19. The sets have been sanitised.

items.title: Bengal polls: BJP threatening voters in Nandigram, says Mamata Banerjee
items.description: Mamata Banerjee has claimed that the BJP goons were harassing voters in Nandigram, the constituency she is contesting against her protégé-turned-rival Suvendu Adhikari.

items.title: IPL 2021: Lucky that I would be playing under MS Dhoni, it's an emotional moment for me - Cheteshwar Pujara
items.description: IPL 2021: India batsman Cheteshwar Pujara, who is making an IPL comeback after a gap of 7 years, has said that he will be lucky to play again under the captaincy of MS Dhoni. Pujara termed his return to the T20 league as an emotional moment.

items.title: Negative RT-PCR report must for visitors from high Covid-load states in Uttarakhand
items.description: People, especially from states where cases of Covid-19 are increasing, will be required to produce a negative Covid test report before they can enter Uttarakhand, Chief Minister Tirath Singh Rawat said on Tuesday.

items.title: Madhuri Dixit in denim shorts and shirt says hello from Maldives. Trending pic
items.description: Madhuri Dixit is holidaying in the Maldives and shared a photo from the exotic destination on Instagram.

items.title: 11-year-old girl decapitated after truck brushes past bus in Madhya Pradesh
items.description: An 11-year-old girl was killed via decapitation after a truck brushed past the bus she was in. The girl had her head out of the window at the moment.

items.title: Centre denied Gujarat Rs 3,370 crore relief for 2018 drought: State govt
items.description: The Gujarat government on Tuesday informed the Legislative Assembly that the Centre had decided not to grant financial assistance of Rs 3,370 crore to the state as relief for the 2018 drought.

items.title: Ajaz Khan picked up from Mumbai airport by NCB in drugs case
items.description: Bigg Boss fame Ajaz Khan was picked up from the Mumbai airport today by the Narcotics Control Bureau in a drug case. He is being questioned.

items.title: IPL 2021: CSK will struggle this season because 4 out their top 7 don't have game time, says Aakash Chopra
items.description: CSK's new squad for IPL 2021 comprises of players like MS Dhoni, Ambati Rayudu and Suresh Raina, who have retired from all forms of international cricket.

items.title: Natasa Stankovic and Hardik Pandya's son Agastya turns 8 months old. See adorable photo
items.description: Natasa Stankovic and Hardik Pandya's son, Agastya, turns eight months old today. The actress shared an adorable pic of her son on Instagram.

items.title: Pakistan's top leadership hit by Covid-19; President and defence minister latest victims
items.description: Pakistan's top leadership has been hit by the coronavirus with President Dr Arif Alvi and Defence Minister Pervez Khattak contracting it, days after Prime Minister Imran Khan and his wife tested positive for the disease which is now raging in the country.

items.title: IPL 2021: Virat Kohli to join RCB on April 1, Yuzvendra Chahal among 11 at training camp in Chennai
items.description: Indian Premier League: While Virat Kohli is all set to join Royal Challengers Bangalore on April 1, the former finalists have begun preparation for IPL 2021 with a 9-day conditioning camp in Chennai.

items.title: Fact Check: Another lockdown in Delhi? No, this was last year’s announcement by Kejriwal
items.description: A video by “ABP News” is being shared widely in which Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal is announcing a lockdown once again till March 31. India Today's AFWA probes the truth.

items.title: Assam election: Second and third phase polls crucial for both BJP and Congress
items.description: After the first phase of voting in the Assam assembly election on March 27, both the BJP-led alliance and the Congress-led Mahajot are gearing up for the crucial second and third phases.

items.title: Global banks brace for losses worth more than $6 billion from Archegos fallout
items.description: Japan's Nomura and Credit Suisse of Switzerland warned of major losses from lending to Archegos for equity derivatives trades, triggering a worldwide sell-off in banking stocks. Morgan Stanley shares fell 2.6% and Goldman Sachs Group dropped 1.7%. Here is all you need to know:

items.title: Why so much mystery over Amit Shah-Sharad Pawar meeting
items.description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah and NCP chief Sharad Pawar met in Ahmedabad last week. The meeting has triggered a range of speculation in the wake of political drama that unfolded in Maharashtra over the Antilia bomb scare case. India Today TV’s Sahil Joshi brings you an analysis.

items.title: Ashley Giles feels going toe-to-toe with England players over IPL participation can be dangerous
items.description: ECB's director of cricket Ashely Giles has reckoned that England could lose their star cricketers if barred from playing in the Indian Premier League (IPL). He added participation of England internationals in IPL should not be a slow kiss of death for England cricket.

items.title: Kozhikode: On campaign trail with Noorbina Rasheed, IUML’s first woman candidate in 25 years
items.description: Noorbina Rasheed, a practicing lawyer, is the Indian Union Muslim League's first woman candidate in 25 years. She will be contesting the Kerala assembly election from the South Kozhikode constituency.

items.title: RBI’s upcoming digital currency to be like cash: Report
items.description: RBI's upcoming digital currency is likely to be like cash and will use private blockchain technology. Here is all you need to know:

items.title: Ever Given goes floating in Suez Canal, tug-boat crew has the best reaction. Viral video
items.description: As Ever Given went floating in Suez Canal, the tug-boat crew celebrated their achievement. The video has gone viral on social media.

items.title: Sergio Aguero's departure triggers race between Manchester clubs to sign star striker Erling Haaland
items.description: Manchester City will be keen on signing Erling Haaland as Sergio Aguero is all set to leave the Etihad club at the end of the season. Manchester United are also firmly interested in getting the Borussia Dortmund striker after failing to land him last year.

items.title: Bengal polls: On last day of Nandigram campaign, Mamata Banerjee gets back on her feet for national anthem
items.description: An injured Mamata Banerjee got back on her feet during the national anthem at the closing ceremony of a rally in Nandigram. This was the last rally before the most crucial seat in Bengal -- Nandigram goes to the polls in two days.

items.title: Kerala election: BJP opened its account here 5 years ago, we will now shut it, says CM Vijayan
items.description: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan has said that the BJP's 'account' in the state will be shut in the upcoming assembly election of 2021. Five years ago, the BJP won its first and only seat in the state in Nemom constituency.

items.title: Kareena Kapoor Khan takes off mask for pics, but has a request for paps. Watch video
items.description: Kareena Kapoor Khan posed for the paps recently. When she was asked to take her mask off, the actress had a special request.

items.title: Mumbai Indians pacer Jasprit Bumrah ready for IPL 2021: Quarantining and getting those reps in
items.description: Jasprit Bumrah has been on an extended break from professional cricket owing to his marriage with TV presenter Sanjana Ganesan earlier this month. Bumrah will make his comeback in the opening match of IPL 2021 between Mumbai Indians and Royal Challengers Bangalore on April 9.

items.title: Man gets Chand ka Tukda from the sky in TV soap. Internet can't handle viral video
items.description: A hilarious scene from the Star Plus TV soap Yehh Jadu Hai Jinn Ka has found itself becoming a meme after it got viral on the Internet. It shows a man trying to break a piece of moon to marry his lover.

items.title: A year of pandemic: Most labourers back in Delhi-NCR but struggling to make ends meet
items.description: Most migrant labourers who were forced to return back home due to Covid-induced lockdown have returned to Delhi-NCR, but things are not the same. India Today TV's Abhishek Anand met a few to understand the challenges they are facing.

items.title: Shweta Tiwari in pink co-ord set is all smiles. Fans say, dream girl
items.description: Shweta Tiwari shared new photos from her latest photoshoot on Instagram. The television actress can be seen dressed in a pink co-ord set.

items.title: Priyanka sends Lara Dutta a copy of Unfinished, thanks her for being a part of her story
items.description: Priyanka Chopra sent a copy of her memoir Unfinished to Lara Dutta. The Quantico star wrote that she hoped their memories match.

items.title: 8 members of Indian boxing squad including 3 boxers test positive for Covid-19 in Turkey
items.description: Eight members of the Indian boxing squad which was in Turkey for the Bosphorus Boxing Tournament, have tested positive for Covid-19. Gaurav Solanki, who claimed the only medal for India in men's category, is among three pugilists who have tested positive.

items.title: IPL 2021: Ben Stokes and I have different roles at Rajasthan Royals, he is one of the best - Chris Morris
items.description: Indian Premier League: Chris Morris said he is looking forward to working with Sanju Samson, adding he shared a good relationship with the newly-appointed captain. The South Africa all-rounder became the most expensive buy at the IPL 2021 auction.

items.title: Aaj Sajeya song out. Alaya F is a modern bride who loves sneakers in new music video
items.description: Alaya F features as a new-age bride in the new music video, Aaj Sajeya. Sung by Goldie Sohel, the song has been directed by Punit Malhotra and produced by Dharma 2.0.

items.title: Life is not always fair: Cyrus Mistry's emotional statement after SC upholds removal from Tata Sons
items.description: Cyrus Mistry has issued an emotional statement after the Supreme Court recently upheld his removal as executive chairman of Tata Sons. Mistry said he is grateful for the opportunity to represent the iconic group but added that life is not always fair.

items.title: Yami Gautam shares first look as mastermind Naina Jaiswal from A Thursday
items.description: Taking to Instagram, Yami Gautam shared her first look as Naina Jaiswal from A Thursday. The film also stars Dimple Kapadia and Neha Dhupia.

items.title: Mouni Roy in Rs 5k yellow anarkali kurta shines bright during meeting with Sadhguru. See pics
items.description: Mouni Roy visited the Isha Yoga Center in Coimbatore and met Sadhguru over the weekend. She was resplendent in a yellow anarkali kurta.

items.title: Mamata Banerjee vs Suvendu Adhikari: The Nandigram story heads to April 1 climax
items.description: Election campaign ends here on Tuesday evening with top two contenders, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and BJP’s Suvendu Adhikari, claiming enough support to win the seats.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty end higher as D-Street ignores rising Covid cases
items.description: The blue-chip NSE Nifty 50 index rose 2.3% to 14,845.10 and the benchmark S&P BSE Sensex gained 2.2% at 50,084. Both the indexes fell more than 1% last week.

items.title: Delhi reports less than 1,000 new Covid cases after a week
items.description: After a week of reporting over 1,000 new Covid-19 cases daily, Delhi on Tuesday reported 992 new cases, 1,591 recoveries and four deaths in the last 24 hours.

items.title: Meghalaya: 5 die at deep well construction site in West Jaintia Hills, 2 rescued
items.description: Five people working at a deep well construction site died in Meghalaya’s West Jaintia Hills. Toxic fumes emitting from a water pump reportedly led to deaths.

items.title: Dharmesh rejected Sanya Malhotra on reality show 6 years ago, Pagglait star reveals on DD3
items.description: Sanya Malhotra recently appeared as a guest on Dance Deewane 3 where she revealed that Dharmesh Yelande had rejected her in the auditions of a dance reality show six years ago. The actress was promoting her film Pagglait.

items.title: IPL 2021: While batting together we do not talk a lot of sense- RR’s Sanju Samson on his rapport with Ben Stokes
items.description: Newly-appointed skipper for Rajasthan Royals, Sanju Samson, was speaking about his rapport with team-mate Ben Stokes and said that the two players never talk a lot of sense when they bat together.

items.title: NIA seizes another high-end car of Sachin Vaze from Navi Mumbai
items.description: The NIA, which is investigating the Mukesh Ambani bomb scare case and the murder of Mansukh Hiren, has seized another high-end car from Kamothe.

items.title: 2nd T20I: Glenn Phillips, Adam Milne lead New Zealand to victory in rain-curtailed match vs Bangladesh
items.description: Bangladesh fell short of the revised target of 171 from 16 overs by 28 runs in the 2nd T20I and now trail 2-0 in the three-match series.

items.title: Russell Crowe joins the cast of Chris Hemsworth's Thor Love and Thunder
items.description: Russell Crowe was spotted hanging out with the cast of Thor: Love and Thunder in Australia. The film stars Chris Hemsworth in the lead role.

items.title: Six children burnt alive as straw house catches fire in Bihar's Araria
items.description: Six children were burnt alive while cooking corn inside a thatched house in Bihar's Araria district on Wednesday.

items.title: India vs England: Leader of the pack Bhuvneshwar Kumar fulfilled Jasprit Bumrah's role - Ajay Jadeja
items.description: India vs England: Former India batsman Ajay Jadeja has praised Bhuvneshwar Kumar for fulfilling the role of Jasprit Bumrah in his absence and added that the pacer uses his mind and not just his aggression.

items.title: Old Delhi man sells Butter Coffee at his stall near Jama Masjid. Internet reacts to viral video
items.description: A man in Old Delhi has been selling Butter Coffee at his stall near Jama Masjid. The video has gone viral on social media.

items.title: DMK’s chaiwala moment? How A Raja gave momentum to EPS’s ‘farmer’s son’ narrative against Stalin
items.description: In an election that has been touted as DMK's, the danger of Raja turning out to be the Mani Shankar Aiyar of the party loomed large.

items.title: Woman says New York Governor Cuomo forcibly kissed her cheeks in 2017
items.description: A woman alleged that New York Governor Andrew Cuomo grabbed her face and kissed her cheek at her home during a visit to inspect local flood damage.

items.title: Devoleena spots 50 men without masks on Holi, questions Maha govt's lockdown rules
items.description: Devoleena Bhattacharjee recently spotted almost 50 men riding bikes on Holi without masks. She took to Twitter and questioned the Maharashtra government's new lockdown rules.

items.title: UP cop replaces sanitiser with Gangajal, smears chandan paste on people visiting police station
items.description: A cop in Uttar Pradesh has replaced sanitiser with Gangajal and is smearing chandan paste of people visiting his police station in a bid to purify them.

items.title: Tiger Shroff shot Baaghi 2 helicopter scene without a body double. On Tuesday Trivia
items.description: Baaghi 2 completes three years today and on this week’s Tuesday Trivia, we will talk about how Tiger Shroff shot for some jaw-dropping action sequences without a body double in the film.

items.title: Justin Langer reacts to Steve Smith's hopes of regaining Australia captaincy: No captaincy position available
items.description: Steve Smith had said he would be open to considering Australia captaincy if it's offered to him but head coach Justin Langer has seemingly quashed his hopes, saying Australian cricket is in good hands at the moment.

items.title: Minor rape survivor paraded with accused in Madhya Pradesh, child rights body seeks report
items.description: A child rights body has asked the Madhya Pradesh Police to submit an inquiry report in connection with the alleged rape of a minor who was paraded with the accused in public.

items.title: Woman raped near Mamata’s camp in Nandigram, how can women be safe under her, asks Amit Shah
items.description: Referring to an incident of rape in Nandigram, Union Home Minister Amit Shah raised questions on the safety of women in the state. “Mamata has to be defeated to bring about much-desired change in Bengal,” Amit Shah said in Nandigram.

items.title: Japanese retail sales fell for 3rd straight month amid weak consumer spending
items.description: Analysts expect Japan's economy to sharply contract in the first quarter, as lacklustre consumer spending and weakening exports create challenges for policymakers who have already rolled out massive stimulus.

items.title: West Bengal polls: BJP supporters greet Mamata Banerjee with 'Jai Shri Ram' slogans in Nandigram
items.description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee was greeted with 'Jai Shri Ram' slogans by BJP supporters in Nandigram on Tuesday.

items.title: I chose Nandigram over Singur because...: Mamata Banerjee reveals the reason
items.description: With BJP labelling her as an 'outsider' in Nandigram, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said she would not leave the constituency and 'is here to stay'.

items.title: There is no reason to replace Virat Kohli: Former selector Sarandeep Singh on split-captaincy debate
items.description: Sarandeep Singh doesn't see the need for split-captaincy in Indian cricket even though Rohit Sharma's winning percentage (78.94%) is far superior to that of Virat Kohli's (65.11%) in T20 internationals.

items.title: Plenty of Vaccines, but Not Enough Arms: A Warning Sign in Cherokee Nation
items.description: The tribe in Oklahoma is facing a problem that is likely to become more commonplace across the country: how to vaccinate everyone not eagerly lining up for a shot.
